intro: Campanula patula var. latifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet, typically blooming in summer. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are broader than the standard variety, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it a popular choice for gardens. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
